verses.verse: Praise<WH8416> waits<WH1747> for you<WH430>, O God, in Sion<WH6726>: and unto you shall the vow<WH5088> be performed<WH7999>.
O you that hear<WH8085> prayer<WH8605>, unto you shall all flesh<WH1320> come<WH935>.
Iniquities<WH1697> prevail<WH1396> against me<WH6588>: as for our transgressions, you shall purge them away<WH3722>.

Blessed<WH835> is the man whom you choose<WH977>, and cause to approach<WH7126> unto you<WH7931>, that he may live in your courts<WH2691>: we shall be satisfied<WH7646> with the goodness<WH2898> of your house<WH1004>, even of your holy<WH6918> temple<WH1964>.

By terrible things<WH3372> in righteousness<WH6664> will you answer<WH6030> us<WH430>, O God of our salvation<WH3468>; who are the confidence<WH4009> of all the ends<WH7099> of the earth<WH776>, and of them that are afar off<WH7350> upon the sea<WH3220>:
Which by his strength<WH3581> sets fast<WH3559> the mountains<WH2022>; being girded<WH247> with power<WH1369>:
Which stills<WH7623> the noise<WH7588> of the seas<WH3220>, the noise<WH7588> of their waves<WH1530>, and the tumult<WH1995> of the people<WH3816>.
They also that live<WH3427> in the outermost parts<WH7099> are afraid<WH3372> at your signs<WH226>: you make the outgoings<WH4161> of the morning<WH1242> and evening<WH6153> to rejoice<WH7442>.

You visit<WH6485> the earth<WH776>, and water<WH7783> it<WH7227>: you greatly enrich<WH6238> it with the river<WH6388> of God<WH430>, which is full<WH4390> of water<WH4325>: you prepare<WH3559> them corn<WH1715>, when you have so provided for it<WH3559>.

You water<WH7301> the ridges<WH8525> there abundantly<WH7301>: you settle<WH5181> the furrows<WH1417> there<WH4127>: you make it soft with showers<WH7241>: you bless<WH1288> the springing there<WH6780>.
You crown<WH5849> the year<WH8141> with your goodness<WH2896>; and your paths<WH4570> drop<WH7491> fatness<WH1880>.
They drop<WH7491> upon the pastures<WH4999> of the wilderness<WH4057>: and the little hills<WH1389> rejoice<WH1524> on every side<WH2296>.
The pastures<WH3733> are clothed<WH3847> with flocks<WH6629>; the valleys<WH6010> also are covered over<WH5848> with corn<WH1250>; they shout for joy<WH7321>, they also sing<WH7891>.
